verbs.description: metastasize (third-person singular simple present metastasizes, present participle metastasizing, simple past and past participle metastasized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, medicine, of a disease or tumor) To spread to other sites in the body; to undergo metastasis.
examples: On other screens are closeups of skin pores, before and after, details of regimes for everything, your hands, your neck, your thighs. Your elbows, especially your elbows: aging begins at the elbows and metastasizes.

entries.meaning: (transitive, medicine, of a disease or tumor) To form a metastasis in (an organ).
(intransitive, figuratively) To spread, especially in a destructive manner.
(transitive, figuratively) To spread or disseminate, especially in a destructive manner.
